definition: using a talented person in an insignificant position (idiom)/a sledgehammer to crack a nut
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
material/timber/ability/aptitude/a capable individual/coffin (old)
small/tiny/few/young
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: I am way overqualified for this job.
sentences.chinese: 這對我來說是大材小用。
嗨，可能這對你真是有點大材小用。

sentences.english: But they decided I was overqualified for the job.
sentences.chinese: 但是就此工作，他們認爲我資歷過高，大材小用。

sentences.english: Don't burn down your house to frighten the mouse away.
sentences.chinese: 本意是毋須燒房趕老鼠，我的理解是大材小用。

sentences.english: When you think about it, cars are often overkill.
sentences.chinese: 仔細想想便會發現，汽車通常都是大材小用。

sentences.english: Why does he always enjoy being a big fish in a small pond?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼他總喜歡把自己大材小用呢？

sentences.english: Status Offline Don't burn down your house to frighten the mouse away.
sentences.chinese: 本意是毋須燒房趕老鼠，我的理解是大材小用。

sentences.english: It's a waste of John to employ him on this easy work.
sentences.chinese: 利用約翰做這項容易的工作是大材小用。

definition: to waste talent
cannon fire to hit a mosquito/to use a sledgehammer to crack a nut
don't use a sledgehammer on a nut/aquila non capit muscam
pinyin: sha1 ji1 yan1 yong4 niu2 dao1

definition: to waste natural resources recklessly/not to know how to use things sparingly
to do more than is required (idiom); superfluous/gilding the lily
enough and to spare (idiom)
a hero with no chance of using his might/to have no opportunity to display one's talents
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 wu2 yong4 wu3 zhi1 di4

definition: to cast pearls before swine (idiom)/not to get proper recognition for one's talents
to make a big fuss over a minor issue (idiom)
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
chicken ribs/sth of little value or interest/sth of dubious worth that one is reluctant to give up/to be physically weak
unavoidably/can't help/really/rather
to force someone to do something
to put sb in powerful position/to empower
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
